circumstances: Enroute from Flint to Saint Louis on a cargo flight, the crew encountered poor weather with low visibility and severe icing conditions. The crew informed ATC about his situation and lost control of the aircraft that crashed in a prairie. The aircraft was destroyed and both crewmen were killed.
probable_cause: It is believed that the loss of control may have been caused by the simultaneous failure of both engines, because the carburetors was stuck by icing.
